channel.title: Portforwarding issue(I think)
channel.description:
If i have my server on it says this on canyouseeme:
Success: I can see your service on [b]*[/b] on port ([b]43594[/b]) Your ISP is not blocking port 43594
But when it is off it says this:
Error: I could not see your service on [b]*[/b] on port ([b]43594[/b]) Reason: Connection refused
When it is online, my server does not recieve a connection from canyouseeme, nor can I login through my own IP. I'm not sure what is causing this, but I cannot host my server if this continues. I'd really appreciate help from anyone that can fix this.

item.title: Portforwarding issue(I think)
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Jmood:

You should be able to connect even if you’re the host…

Well I’m not sure then, I really don’t see any errors in the portforwarding. I allowed it through my PC’s firewall and my Router’s firewall. But still I cannot connect.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding issue(I think)
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Jmood:

Are you sure your client is connecting to your ip or local host?

To my ip. 99.195..

Edit: Can you test logging into my server? Maybe I just can’t connect because I’m the host.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding issue(I think)
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

If i have my server on it says this on canyouseeme:

Success: I can see your service on * on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594

But when it is off it says this:

Error: I could not see your service on * on port (43594)
Reason: Connection refused

When it is online, my server does not recieve a connection from canyouseeme, nor can I login through my own IP. I’m not sure what is causing this, but I cannot host my server if this continues. I’d really appreciate help from anyone that can fix this.

Read full topic
